flawed_nl_solution:
James earns 20*0.2=$<<20*0.2=4>>4 less while working his second job
So he earns 20-4=$<<20-4=61>>61 an hour
At his first job he earns 20*30=$<<20*30=600>>600
He works 30/2=<<30/2=15>>15 hours at his second job
So he earns 15*61=$<<15*61=915>>915
So he earns 600+915=$<<600+915=1515>>1515 a week
#### 1515

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 61. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
